PROMPTSETXUI.XUIEDITOR:
<dialog height="506" icon="PRPT" id="PRPTS" left="279" top="4" width="420"><readpanel fill="b" id="PRPTBOX" nl="1" scroll="v" text="Parameters"><properties><entry name="text">Parameters</entry><entry name="modifiable">0</entry></properties><combo dynamic="0" enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIAs.00" nl="1" quotes="" text="Search criteria" tooltip="The selection criteria defines which type of entities (packages, files etc..) want to query. The option &UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME# defines the name of the entity to look up. list packages: list all packages in /var/lib/dpkg/status, excluding the ones marked with state purge. search pattern: &UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME# defines the packages to list. If empty, all packages are listed.Normal shell wildchars are allowed in package-name-pattern. Please note you will probably have to quote package-name-pattern to prevent the shell from performing filename expansion. custom formatting: with &UC4RB_OUTPUT_FORMAT# you may define a custom formatting of your package list. If empty, the default package list formatting of dpkg is applied. (implementation note: if format not empty, the option "-l" is used at command line, if not, the option "-W" is used) list files in a package: List files installed to your system from package-name defined by &UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME#. However, note that files created by package-specific installation-scripts are not listed. Custom formatting of output is not possible (value of &UC4RB_OUTPUT_FORMAT#) is ignored search files in packages: Search for a filename (=defined in &UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME#) from installed packages. All standard shell wildchars can be used in the pattern. This command will not list extra files created by maintainer scripts, nor will it list alternatives." alt="1" filter="0" strict="1" vtype="i"><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command owner="_self" owneraction="setsource" ownerparam="src|_dialog@src"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptcombolist" target="_self" targetaction="setlist" wait="0"/><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC4_RV.PM_DEB.SEARCH_CRITERIA</entry><entry name="text">Search criteria</entry><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIAs.00</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">The selection criteria defines which type of entities (packages, files etc..) want to query. The option &UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME# defines the name of the entity to look up.
list packages: list all packages in /var/lib/dpkg/status, excluding the ones marked with state purge.
search pattern: &UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME# defines the packages to list. If empty, all packages are listed.Normal shell wildchars are allowed in package-name-pattern. Please note you will probably have to quote package-name-pattern to prevent the shell from performing filename expansion.
custom formatting: with &UC4RB_OUTPUT_FORMAT# you may define a custom formatting of your package list. If empty, the default package list formatting of dpkg is applied. (implementation note: if format not empty, the option "-l" is used at command line, if not, the option "-W" is used)
list files in a package: List files installed to your system from package-name defined by &UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME#. However, note that files created by package-specific installation-scripts are not listed. Custom formatting of output is not possible (value of &UC4RB_OUTPUT_FORMAT#) is ignored
search files in packages: Search for a filename (=defined in &UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME#) from installed packages. All standard shell wildchars can be used in the pattern. This command will not list extra files created by maintainer scripts, nor will it list alternatives.</entry><entry name="dynamic">0</entry><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></combo><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAMEs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Search by name" tooltip="Defines the name of the entity to look up. The entity may be a package name/pattern or a file name. See the parameter &UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIA# for more details." upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Search by name</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAMEs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Defines the name of the entity to look up. The entity may be a package name/pattern or a file name. See the parameter &UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIA# for more details.</entry><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text><text enabled="1" fill="b" focus="0" id="UC4RB_FORMAT_PACKAGE_OUTPUTs.00" inputassistance="0" len="" nl="1" regex="" required="0" separator=";" showaspassword="0" text="Format package list output" tooltip="Specify the format of the resulting package list. Note, that you can use this option only, if &UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIA#='list packages'. When listing files, the value of the parameter is ignored. The format is a string that will be output for each package listed. In the format string backslash \ introduces escapes: \n newline \r carriage return \t tab ?\? before any other character suppresses any special meaning of the following character, which is useful for ?\? and ?$?. Package information can be included by inserting variable references to package fields using the syntax ?${field[;width]}?. Fields are printed right-aligned unless the width is negative in which case left alignment will be used. The following fields are recognised: Architecture, Bugs, Conffiles, Config-Version. Conflicts, Breaks, Depends, Description, Enhances, Essential, Filename, Homepage, Installed-Size, MD5sum, MSDOS-Filename, Maintainer, Origin, Package, Pre-Depends, Priority, Provides, Recommends, Replaces, Revision, Section, Size, Source, Status, Suggests, Tag, Version The default format string is ?${Package}\t${Version}\n?. Actually, all other fields found in the status file (i.e. user defined fields) can be requested, too. They will be printed as is, though, no conversion nor error checking is done on them." upper="0" alt="1" multiline="0" multilineIcon="0"><oninputassistant><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptname|@id"/><command request="_internal" target="_view" targetaction="setAttribute" targetparam="promptvalue|@value"/><command owner="_promptsetcontainer" owneraction="getData" request="getpromptinputassistance" target="_chainwindow"/></oninputassistant><properties><entry listparam="C" name="reference" reftype="STATIC">UC_DATATYPE_STRING</entry><entry name="text">Format package list output</entry><entry name="multiselect">0</entry><entry name="separator">;</entry><entry name="len"/><entry name="quotes"/><entry name="id">UC4RB_FORMAT_PACKAGE_OUTPUTs.00</entry><entry name="inputassistance">0</entry><entry name="enabled">0</entry><entry name="upper">0</entry><entry name="focus">0</entry><entry name="showaspassword">0</entry><entry name="tooltip">Specify the format of the resulting package list. Note, that you can use this option only, if &UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIA#='list packages'. When listing files, the value of the parameter is ignored. The format is a string that will be output for each package listed. In the format string backslash \ introduces escapes:
\n newline
\r carriage return
\t tab
?\? before any other character suppresses any special meaning of the following character, which is useful for ?\? and ?$?.
Package information can be included by inserting variable references to package fields using the syntax ?${field[;width]}?. Fields are printed right-aligned unless the width is negative in which case left alignment will be used. The following fields are recognised:
Architecture, Bugs, Conffiles, Config-Version. Conflicts, Breaks, Depends, Description, Enhances, Essential, Filename, Homepage, Installed-Size, MD5sum, MSDOS-Filename, Maintainer, Origin, Package, Pre-Depends, Priority, Provides, Recommends, Replaces, Revision, Section, Size, Source, Status, Suggests, Tag, Version
The default format string is ?${Package}\t${Version}\n?. Actually, all other fields found in the status file (i.e. user defined fields) can be requested, too. They will be printed as is, though, no conversion nor error checking is done on them.</entry><entry name="modifiable">1</entry><entry name="regex"/><entry name="required">0</entry><entry name="initvalue"/><entry name="xmlkey"/><entry name="xmlpath"/><entry name="multiline">0</entry><entry name="multilineIcon">0</entry><entry name="customfield"/><entry name="onchangereset"/><entry name="resetable">1</entry></properties></text></readpanel></dialog>

PROMPTSETDATA.DATAEDITOR: <PRPTS ontop="1"><PRPTBOX><UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIAs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIA#" ReadFromTable="OPSE">list packages</UC4RB_SEARCH_CRITERIAs.00><UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAMEs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAME#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></UC4RB_SEARCH_BY_NAMEs.00><UC4RB_FORMAT_PACKAGE_OUTPUTs.00 haslist="0" msgnr="-1" msginsert="" altview="0" promptname="UC4RB_FORMAT_PACKAGE_OUTPUT#" ReadFromTable="OPSE"></UC4RB_FORMAT_PACKAGE_OUTPUTs.00></PRPTBOX></PRPTS>
